intro: Navarretia paradoxinota, commonly known as the paradoxical navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats, such as grasslands and coastal dunes. It produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Navarretia paradoxinota is known for its short lifespan, often completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
